pcricketstats
Class StatUtilities

java.lang.Object
  pcricketstats.StatUtilities

public class StatUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

This is the class responsible for calculating statistics from the data in the CSV file.The outputSort method handles the sorting - by providing the user with options specified by an integer value.The sorting itself is handled by the Comparator classes.

Author:
Rob Attfield

Method Detail

listNPlayers

public void listNPlayers(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                         int noOfPlayers)
This method prints out the number of players specified by the user.

Parameters:
players - The list of players to be printed out.
noOfPlayers - The number of players to be listed.

listNPlayers

public void listNPlayers(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                         int start,
                         int end)
This overloaded method will print out the details of each player - that appear between "start" and "end" indexes of the players list.

Parameters:
players - The list of players to be printed out.
start - The list position of the first player.
end - The list position of the last player.

aveInningsPerCountry

public double aveInningsPerCountry(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                                   java.lang.String country)
This overloaded method calculates the average amount of innings per player played, in a particular country.

Parameters:
players - The list of players to perform the calculation.
country - The country to get the average innings played per player.
Returns:
The average innings played per player, from the defined country.

aveInningsPerPlayer

public double aveInningsPerPlayer(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
This method gets the average innings played by each player, over the whole data set.

Parameters:
players - The list of players to perform the calculation.
Returns:
The average innings played per player.

listPlayersCountry

public java.lang.String listPlayersCountry(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                                           java.lang.String country)
This method gets a list of players from a particular country.

Parameters:
players - The list of players to perform the calculation.
country - The country where the players would be from.
Returns:
The player's name and country they play for.

outputSort

public void outputSort(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                       int chosenOption)
This method is responsible for sorting the entire list of players.

Parameters:
players - The list of players to be sorted
chosenOption - An integer value to choose a sorting option. || 0 = "Sort by balls bowled" || 1 = "Sort by bowling average" || 2 = "Sort by career span" || 3 = "Sort by country name" || 4 = "Sort by economy rate" || 5 = "Sort by number of 5 wicket bags" || 6 = "Sort by matches played" || 7 = "Sort by innings played" || 8 = "Sort by player name" || 9 = "Sort by runs conceded" || 10 = "Sort by strike rate" || 11 = "Sort by wickets taken" ||
